meanings.definition: A person who uses a garrote to strangle or choke someone.
meanings.sent1: The garrotter silently approached his victim in the dark alley.
meanings.sent2: The police were on the lookout for the notorious garrotter in the city.
meanings.sent3: The garrotter decided to take up knitting instead of his usual activities.
meanings.sent4: She was a garrotter of boredom, always finding ways to spice up mundane tasks.
meanings.sent5: The garrotter's shadow loomed large over the unsuspecting prey.

meanings.definition: To strangle or choke someone with a garrote.
meanings.sent1: He attempted to garrotter the enemy spy before he could raise an alarm.
meanings.sent2: The assassin planned to garrotter his target without leaving any evidence behind.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to garrotter her brother if he didn't stop teasing her.
meanings.sent4: The vines seemed to garrotter the tree, slowly strangling its life away.
meanings.sent5: The silence in the room was broken only by the sound of the garrotter tightening.
